feed.title: Current watches, warnings, and advisories for United States land zones

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued July 10 at 3:04PM EDT until July 10 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Wilmington OH
entry.summary:
FFWILN
The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Delaware County in central Ohio... Northeastern Franklin County in central Ohio...
* Until 530 PM EDT.
* At 304 PM EDT, radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Powell, Dublin, Westerville, Upper Arlington, Gahanna, Hilliard, Worthington, Minerva Park, Polaris, Easton, Shawnee Hills, Riverlea, Clintonville, Lewis Center, Huber Ridge and Columbus Zoo.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Delaware, OH; Franklin, OH

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 11:01AM AKDT until July 11 at 11:45AM AKDT by NWS Juneau AK
entry.summary:
An incoming weather system will spread rain into the southern panhandle starting Thursday afternoon with gusty winds of 25 to 35 mph possible. Heaviest rainfall rate will be Thursday evening to early Friday morning.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...Ward Lake near areas near the Ward Lake recreational area.
* WHEN...Until 1145 AM AKDT Friday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1053 AM AKDT, river gauge reports indicate water levels on Ward Lake remain steady. An approaching system will bring heavy rain across the area on Thursday with minor flooding expected to begin by Thursday night and early Friday morning, especially near Ward Lake. Rain rates of 0.2 to 0.3 inches per hours as the front is moving into the area and rainfall total amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible. Lake Connell Dam had a height of 250.0 feet Thursday morning. Forecast crest height near 252.0 ft by Friday morning, entering flood stage.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Ketchikan Gateway Borough

cap:parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM AKDT FRIDAY

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 2:49PM EDT until July 10 at 4:45PM EDT by NWS Jackson KY
entry.summary:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Kentucky, including the following county, Letcher.
* WHEN...Until 445 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 248 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms in an area that experienced heavy rain yesterday. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain have fallen. This will cause urban and small stream flooding in locations where soils are already wet. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Whitesburg, Jenkins, Fleming-Neon, Ermine, Colly, Bellcraft, Marlowe, Southdown, Mayking, Sergent, Winters, Farraday, Whitco, Crown, Dongola, Ice, Millstone, Oven Fork, Thornton and Day.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued July 10 at 2:35PM EDT until July 11 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Raleigh NC
entry.summary:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible.
* WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Alamance, Anson, Chatham, Davidson, Durham, Forsyth, Granville, Guilford, Hoke, Lee, Montgomery, Moore, Orange, Person, Randolph, Richmond, Scotland, Stanly, Vance and Warren.
* WHEN...Until 2 AM EDT Friday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations, especially those that saw flooding on Sunday and Monday from the remnants of Chantal. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Slow moving thunderstorms capable of producing torrential rainfall over already saturated soils may result in flooding through Thursday night. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 3:09AM AKDT until July 10 at 9:30PM AKDT by NWS Juneau AK
entry.summary:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst continues.
* WHERE...The Salmon River near areas around mile marker 9 of the Salmon River highway.
* WHEN...Until 930 PM AKDT Thursday.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1045 PM AKDT, a trained weather spotter reported that the river water is murky and muddy, flowing quickly, and about 4 ft above its normal level. Spotter further reported that the water levels had been rising quickly with the river flow getting rougher and making surf/waves in its flow with trees on the edge of the riverbank starting to erode into the river. This indicates that a glacier-dammed lake outburst in areas around mile marker 9 of the Salmon River highway is occurring. Water is not crossing over the road at this time. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, especially near the Salmon River. - Inherent uncertainty in initial glacier lake volume will result in varying crest height and timing.
- Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hyder.
entry.cap:areaDesc: City of Hyder

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued July 9 at 5:03PM PDT by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
entry.summary:
* WHAT...The South Coast AQMD has updated an air quality alert due to harmful levels of ozone pollution.
* WHERE...In Metropolitan Los Angeles, the San Fernando Valley, Santa Clarita, and the San Gabriel Mountains. Levels of ozone pollution can vary by time and location depending on emissions and air pollution transport.
* WHEN...Until Thursday at 800 PM PDT. The highest ozone levels typically occur in the afternoon and early-evening hours.
* IMPACTS...Ozone air pollution can cause serious health problems, including trouble breathing, asthma attacks, and lung damage. Everyone can be affected, but sensitive groups such as people with lung disease, older adults, people who are pregnant, children, and those who spend a lot of time outdoors are at greater risk.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...To help keep indoor air clean when air quality is poor: 00
* Keep windows and doors closed * Run your air conditioner and/or an air purifier * Do not use whole house fans or swamp coolers that bring in outside air if you have other methods to stay cool * Avoid other sources of pollution such as fireplaces, candles, incense, and grilling
To help minimize outdoor ozone air pollution levels:

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 9 at 1:49PM AKDT by NWS Juneau AK
entry.summary:
Thursday into Friday, an impactful frontal system with an associated weak to moderate Atmospheric River, primarily aimed at the southern Panhandle, will move over southeast Alaska. This system will bring moderate to heavy rainfall and strong winds to a widespread area. The heaviest precipitation looks to focus over the southern panhandle with 2 inches of rain in 24 hours. Around southern Baranof Island and at higher elevations, rain totals around or greater than 3 inches are possible in 24 hours. The heaviest of this rain will be Thursday evening with rain rates of 0.1 to 0.15 inches per hour. Isolated areas could see greater than 0.2 inches per hour. A Flood Advisory has also been issued for Ward Lake near Ketchikan.
Winds over the eastern Gulf, Clarence Strait, and near Dixon Entrance will reach gale force of 35 to 40 kts as the front pushes through Thursday. Wind gusts up to 45 to 50 kts are possible near Kayak Island Thursday afternoon. Land areas in the southern panhandle will experience wind gusts up to 40 mph.
entry.cap:areaDesc: City and Borough of Sitka; Prince of Wales Island; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Annette Island
